intro: Heteromalla vestita, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Heteromalla vestita is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
